title: Drawing, "Design for a Coffeepot", 1831–46
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Intended to be executed in metal. Shown in profile with handle at right. Lower section of spout is the coat of arms of Pope Gregory XVI. Lower section of body is fluted. Lid shows calyx upside down. Plant form as finial.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Coffeepot", 1831–46.
1831–46. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5980.
